parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post mentions Corneliu Mureșan, a candidate for the Senate, and implicitly refers to other candidates from AUR, POT, and Forța Dreptei.  While not explicitly naming all candidates, the context clearly links them to the electoral process.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The content is not a private message but rather a news article shared publicly.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While presented as a news article, the post highlights a specific candidate (Corneliu Mureșan) and favorably positions him against other candidates described as "parachute candidates". This framing could sway public opinion in his favor, suggesting an electoral objective. However, the article itself is journalistic in nature, reporting on a political event.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post links to an article from albapesurse.ro, which appears to be a news source. The content itself is presented as a news report, describing the candidacy of Corneliu Mureșan. However, the selective highlighting of Mureșan and the negative portrayal of other candidates blur the line between objective journalism and advocacy.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; it presents information in a way that could be interpreted as biased, but it's not framed as a personal viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1103675518078138</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post walks a fine line. It uses a news article format, which could be considered journalistic, but the content selectively focuses on a specific candidate and negatively frames his opponents. This creates a potential for influencing voters, even if indirectly. The timing of the post (after the official campaign period) is also a concern. While the article itself might not be explicitly calling for votes, the presentation strongly suggests an electoral objective.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement on a public platform further strengthens the argument for it being electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Corneliu Mureșan</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Other AUR, POT, and Forța Dreptei candidates</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Radio HIT FM Alba</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Radio HIT FM Alba, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 1103675518078138) care, deși prezentată sub forma unui articol jurnalistic, promovează candidatul Corneliu Mureșan pentru Senat într-un mod favorabil, denigrând implicit alți candidați de la AUR, POT și Forța Dreptei, prezentându-i ca „candidați parașutați”.  Acest lucru are un efect electoral clar, influențând votul publicului prin prezentarea subiectivă a informației, chiar dacă nu solicită explicit votul pentru Mureșan.  Postarea, fiind o reclamă plătită pe o platformă publică, se încadrează în definiția materialului de propagandă electorală, continuând propaganda electorală după încheierea perioadei legale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
